meanings.definition: (adjective) Used to express annoyance or frustration.
meanings.sent1: I am so doggones tired of waiting in line.
meanings.sent2: She was doggones upset when her phone died during the call.
meanings.sent3: The doggones printer decided to stop working right before the deadline.
meanings.sent4: The doggones traffic made him late for the important meeting.
meanings.sent5: The doggones rain ruined our picnic plans.

meanings.sent1: She ran doggones fast to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: He worked doggones hard to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The kids were playing doggones loudly in the yard.
meanings.sent4: The music was playing doggones loudly at the party.
meanings.sent5: The car sped doggones quickly down the highway.

meanings.sent1: He let out a 'doggones' when he dropped his sandwich.
meanings.sent2: She muttered a 'doggones' under her breath when she realized she forgot her keys.
meanings.sent3: The 'doggones' slipped out of his mouth when he stubbed his toe.
meanings.sent4: A loud 'doggones' echoed through the room when the vase broke.
meanings.sent5: She couldn't help but laugh at the 'doggones' he exclaimed in surprise.
